<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value>arma1

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Sounds

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Triggers

</value></part><part><name>gr3</name>=<value> Waypoints

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Defines the different sound effects. 

* Sound - plays a 2D sound as if [[playSound]] was used from CfgSounds (mission or main config)
* Voice - attaches a 3D sound from CfgSounds (mission or main config) to the object that activated the trigger and plays it as if [[say3D]] was used
* SoundEnv - [Triggers only] plays an environmental sound from CfgEnvSounds (mission or main config)
* SoundDet - [Triggers only] creates a dynamic sound object attached to a trigger defined in [[CfgSFX]] (mission or main config)

To stop any sound, deactivate the trigger (might take up to 0.5 sec to stop) or delete the trigger (immediate). <br><br>

Also use <tt>"$NONE$"</tt> to skip the sound (1st item), when there is none to be used (Example 3, 4, 5).
<template lineStart="1"><title>Wiki</title><part><name index="1"/><value>todo </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Remove the note above in Arma3 v2.04, and remove this from examples as simple "" will work then instead ("$NONE$" still supported) </value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> trigger '''setSoundEffect''' [sound, voice, soundEnv, soundDet]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> trigger: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [sound, voice, soundEnv, soundDet]: [[Array]] of strings, see description

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> waypoint '''setSoundEffect''' [sound, voice]

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> waypoint: [[Array]] - format [[Waypoint]]

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> [sound, voice]: [[Array]] of strings, see description

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_trigger [[setSoundEffect]] ["Alarm", "", "", ""];</code>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code> [_group1,2] [[setSoundEffect]] ["Alarm", ""];</code>
</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_trigger [[setSoundEffect]] ["$NONE$", "Alarm", "", ""];</code>
</value></part><part><name>x4</name>=<value> <code>_trigger [[setSoundEffect]] ["$NONE$", "", "BattlefieldExplosions3", ""];</code>
</value></part><part><name>x5</name>=<value> <code>_trigger [[setSoundEffect]] ["$NONE$", "", "", "Owl"];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[createTrigger]], [[setMusicEffect]], [[setTitleEffect]]
</value></part></template>

<dt class="note">[[User:Neokika|Neokika]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
To avoid having to create a dummy sound definition, you can use $NONE$ instead.

<code>private "_trigger";
_trigger = createTrigger ["EmptyDetector", position player];
_trigger setTriggerStatements ["true", "", ""];
_trigger setSoundEffect ["$NONE$", "", "BattlefieldExplosions3", ""];
</code>
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment><comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on March 7, 2012</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:old_man_auz|old_man_auz]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
When using this function, I found that if the parameter '''sound''' was empty, then you would always get a 'Sound not found' error. The following code fixes this problem. You need to create a dummy sound. This is what example 3 is hinting towards.

description.ext:
<code>class CfgSounds
{
	sounds[] = {};
	class NoSound
	{
		name = "NoSound";
		sound[] = {"", 0, 1};
		titles[] = {};
	}; //Dummy sound needed for setSoundEffect command, due to stupid bug in engine.
};
</code>
(code sample above written by 'CarlGustaffa' on the Bohemia Interactive forums.)

script.sqf:
<code>_trigger = createTrigger[ "EmptyDetector" , _position ];
_trigger setTriggerStatements [ "true" , "" , "" ];
_trigger setSoundEffect[ "NoSound" , "" , "" , "Wind2_EP1" ];
</code>
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
